intro: Potamogeton lucens var. rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leaf pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in North America. It features slender, branching stems that are often covered in small, rounded leaves arranged in whorls. The leaves are typically broad and elliptical, with a smooth, waxy surface that helps reduce water resistance. This plant plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. It is often found in shallow lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams.
